=== Quantum Amplitude Estimation for Tail Risk Analysis ===

Risk Model Configuration:
  Loss distribution qubits: 4 (2^4 = 16 discrete levels)
  Loss threshold: 2.5
  Distribution: Log-normal(μ=0, σ=1)
  Theoretical tail probability P(Loss > 2.5): 0.18977381200856933

QAE Algorithm Parameters:
  Precision qubits: 4 (phase resolution: π/16)
  Repetitions: 24
  Total qubits: 9 (loss + precision + marker)

=== Canonical QAE Results (precision=4 bits, runs=24) ===
Phase measurement histogram (top 10):
  Phase 0/16 (θ=0, P≈0): 19 times
  Phase 8/16 (θ=1.5707963267948966, P≈1): 5 times
Most frequent outcome: phase=0/16, θ=0, P≈0
Mean amplitude estimate: 0.20833333333333334 ± 0.08289816934939807
Theoretical tail probability: 0.18977381200856933
Relative error: 9.779811623284436%

=== Classical Baseline Comparison ===
Monte Carlo (10000 samples): 0.18977381200856933 ± 0.0039212206299098435
  Relative error vs theoretical: 0%

=== Quantum Advantage Analysis ===
QAE precision: ε ≈ 0.08289816934939807
MC precision: ε ≈ 0.0039212206299098435
Precision improvement factor: 0x
Query complexity: QAE uses O(1/ε) = O(12.062992558800829) oracle calls
                  MC uses O(1/ε²) = O(10000) samples

=== Summary ===
Theoretical:     P = 0.18977381200856933
QAE estimate:    P = 0.20833333333333334 ± 0.08289816934939807
MC estimate:     P = 0.18977381200856933 ± 0.0039212206299098435
QAE demonstrates quadratic speedup: O(1/ε) vs O(1/ε²) for precision ε
